ETYMOLOGY: From Old Norse samr ('same'), from Proto-Germanic *samaz, from Proto-Indo-European *somos ('same, one'). Related to Latin similis ('similar') and Greek homos ('same').

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [sth] is the same (as [sth else]) | the same [sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Identical; not different; being one and not another.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We ordered the same meal as last time.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们点了和上次一样的饭。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: pronoun: a word that can function as a noun phrase referring to someone or something previously mentioned or known
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The identical thing or person previously mentioned or implied.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 同一事物；同一个人；相同的情况
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She told me the same thing yesterday.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她昨天告诉我同样的事情。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: a word or phrase that modifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Nonetheless; nevertheless; in spite of what has been said or done.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 仍然；照样；尽管如此（非正式用法）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Even though it was raining, they went out just the same.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 尽管下着雨，他们还是照样出去了。
